text: I just watched the growth theme overview <https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GhPsqtzEjPs> How is this different from the boilerplate? If this uses the best practices, should this become the boilerplate?

Hey Jacob :wave: the boilerplate is intended to be a bit more bare bones so that a developer can use it as a starting point for one of their projects and add onto it as they please. This is more focused towards helping developers build out a new theme using HubSpot.

The Growth theme is more intended for new content creators who might not necessarily have a developer and are getting started on HubSpot. This is meant to give them an out of the box starting point. This theme is a lot more opinionated than boilerplate.

We want to make sure we keep boilerplate a bit more simple than Growth so that developers don't have to go through the hassle of deleting a lot of things they don't necessarily want/need. With that being said you can still download Growth if you want to use some of the approaches/techniques that we offer there (<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/building-blocks/themes/default-themes#growth-theme>). Most of the features/techniques discussed in that developer day presentation in Growth theme we also feature in boilerplate.
ok thank you for explaining that.

No problem :thumbsup: boilerplate is open source and we are always looking for feedback on it so if there is something you like when playing around with Growth theme that isn't over in boilerplate that you think would be useful for most developers - let us know and we'd be happy to take a look at it!
